About the job
            
 
Let’s be unstoppable together!Circana (formerly IRI and NPD) is the leading advisor on the complexity of consumer behavior. Through unparalleled technology, advanced analytics, cross-industry data and deep expertise, we provide clarity that helps almost 7,000 of the world’s leading brands and retailers take action and unlock business growth. At Circana, we are fueled by our passion for continuous learning and growth, we seek and share feedback freely, and we celebrate victories both big and small in an environment that is flexible and accommodating to our work and personal lives. Join our inclusive, committed team to be a challenger, own outcomes, and stay curious together.Learn more at www.circana.com.Business ConsultantIn our client-facing team this is a critical role in which you are responsible for managing our (top) accounts. Your main responsibility is to secure the client satisfaction level and help them further grow based on your knowledge and our solutions to help them meet and exceed their targets. For instance: following trends from multiple segments in order to create potential opportunities for your clients, advice on the best set of deliverables to only offer what matters most to them and make sure all information and insights are consolidated, presented and are ready to be embedded successfully on all levels within the clients organization based on your consultancy skills.Your main responsibilities are:  Translating customer needs (actively or passively founded) into a growth roadmap that will provide our clients with a competitive advantage. This can be achieved by working closely together with our Strategic Insights Analyst, our Client Service Executives, our dedicated Solutions & Insights team, and (when needed) consulting one of our Operational teams.  Operating as the lead point of contact for any and all matters specific to your accounts. Building and maintaining strong, long-lasting customer relationships & Overseeing customer account management, including negotiating contracts and agreements. 
Main Duties & ResponsibilitiesThe most crucial aspect of the role is to gain the highest level of client satisfaction. Meaning we need to do what matters most to help our clients to meet and exceed their targets. Most important tasks to be performed in this role: Serve as the lead point of contact for your account portfolio (both at Circana as well as the client premises)Develop trusted advisor relationships with your accounts, customer stakeholders and executive sponsorsGenerating answer and insights to clients (commercial) challengesDevelop new business with existing clients to meet sales quotas, if needed in cooperation with ‘S&I’-colleagues(Internal) Revenue & Pipeline managementCoaching of (junior) colleaguesManage client expectations & satisfaction (by using IRI’s client scorecard process)Deal with challenging client requests or issue escalations as needed

About the job
            
 
Description   Take your career to the next level in Efficio’s new Lisbon office!If you are a consulting professional looking to advance their career and make a meaningful impact within a global firm, then Efficio’s new Lisbon office is the opportunity for you!We opened the new Lisbon office in early 2023 and we’re looking for talented consultants to join the Lisbon team. At Efficio you will enjoy excellent progression opportunities, a collaborative culture, and exposure to our international client-base.Role Responsibilities:As a Consultant at Efficio you will be responsible for supporting with the delivery of client work:  Manage the collection and analysis of client data, contributing to the development of recommendations and solutions.  Plan and implement agreed strategies, ensuring targeted outcomes are achieved.  Provide support and guidance to Efficio business analysts / junior consultants on projects.  Manage key relationships with client stakeholders, leveraging your knowledge and expertise, and ensuring buy-in to the agreed strategies. 
Requirements Essential Requirements  - An exemplary academic background  Minimum of three years’ relevant management consulting experience Demonstrated interpersonal, strategic, and analytical skills Strong communicator with the ability to influence stakeholders of all levels Fluency in English We operate on hybrid working pattern that combines both remote work and on-site presence. As part of our
dedication to meeting client and business needs, flexibility to travel is essential. Desirable Requirements  - Consulting experience within procurement and/or supply chain preferred, but not essential  Fluency in another European language (Portuguese, Spanish, French, German, Italian)
Eleva a tua carreira para o próximo nível no novo escritório da Efficio em Lisboa!Se és um profissional de consultoria que procura avançar na sua carreira e ter um impacto significativo numa empresa global, o novo escritório da Efficio em Lisboa é a oportunidade para ti! Aberto em 2023, estamos à procura de consultores com talento para se juntarem à equipa em Lisboa. Com a Efficio, vais desfrutar de excelentes oportunidades de progressão, uma cultura colaborativa e exposição à nossa base de clientes internacionais.Acerca da EfficioA Efficio é uma das principais empresas de consultoria em gestão de procurement e supply chain. Crescemos mais de o dobro em tamanho nos últimos anos e estamos a abrir um novo escritório em Lisboa como parte importante do nosso plano de crescimento contínuo. Temos presença na Europa, América do Norte e Médio Oriente, o que significa que farás parte de uma equipa global que apoia projetos em múltiplas geografias. Na Efficio, os consultores desfrutam de um ambiente colaborativo, baseado em mérito, onde o desempenho é reconhecido e recompensado. Um programa de desenvolvimento abrangente suporta o crescimento e progressão de cada membro da equipa.Responsabilidades:Como consultor na Efficio, serás responsável por apoiar a entrega de objetivos para o cliente:  Gerir a coleção e análise de dados do cliente, contribuindo para o desenvolvimento de recomendações e soluções.  Planear e implementar estratégias acordadas, garantindo que os resultados desejados sejam alcançados.  Fornecer suporte e orientação aos consultores juniores da Efficio em projetos.  Gerir relacionamentos-chave com partes relevantes do cliente, avançando conhecimento e garantindo acordo nas estratégias delineadas. 
Competências e experiências necessárias:  Um histórico académico exemplar.  Mínimo de três anos de experiência relevante em consultoria.  Competências interpessoais, estratégicas e analíticas demonstradas.  Forte competências de comunicação com a capacidade de influenciar partes interessadas de todos os níveis.  Dominio de inglês é essencial.  Dominio de português, ou outra língua europeia, é desejável. 
Se estás interessado nesta oportunidade, candidata-te!

job_title: Senior Consultant / ManagerTurnaround and Restructuring Strategy - Strategy and Transactions
job_description:
About the job
            
 
Our TRS team is fully integrated both within our wider Strategy and Transactions practice and our firm as a whole, and our clients reap the benefits of this broad range of knowledge, skills and experience. We work on the basis of creating long-term relationships with our clients and our teams work closely with them to understand their short and long-term goals - being there at every stage to identify problems and recommend and implement solutions that deliver measurable results. The EY Turnaround and Restructuring Strategy (TRS) team is a cohesive team and advises both medium-sized and large companies and their stakeholders (e.g. shareholders, financiers or suppliers) on special situations. Our issues are at the interface of strategy, operations and finance. We guarantee a diverse job in a dynamic transaction-driven practice with many young ambitious colleagues. A "typical day" for a Senior Consultant/Manager within the EY Turnaround and Restructuring Strategy does not exist. What we can say is that your experience will be dynamic, engaging and fun.The opportunity - What future are you building towards?In this role you will advise both medium-sized and large companies and their stakeholders (e.g. shareholders, financiers or suppliers) in special situations, such as liquidity and profitability problems, restructuring, strategy and complex financing issues. You mostly do this by working with your team on location at the company, which means you also get to experience the dynamics of the company and the sector up close. In addition, you will frequently collaborate with other SaT disciplines in the areas of valuations, business modelling, sales guidance, real estate, strategy and operations.We are looking for colleagues to join us in Amsterdam as their home office.Our team - Do great minds always think alike?Within the Turnaround and Restructuring Strategy (TRS) department, we advise organizations when they face underperformance or financial problems. We provide financial and business strategies with a focus on restructuring the company to transform, create, preserve, and restore value. We work with organizations in industries such as private equity, energy, financial services, healthcare and life sciences, retail, FMCG, technology, media, and telecom.Responsibilities – How can you make a lasting impact in a rapidly changing world? Helping clients develop financial and operational strategies to improve liquidity, credit availability and shareholder return.Dealing with competing prioritiesUnderstanding how to manage resourcesCommunicating effectively
Job requirements – Where do you start if you want to change the world? At least 3 years of relevant working experience and a completed University degree (e.g. Business Economics, Business Administration, Econometrics or Accountancy)Strong and verifiable experience and/or affinity with changes, transactions and restructuringStrong analytical skills and experience working with large data files and data visualisation toolsGood communication skills and (preferably) fluent in Dutch and English languages, both verbally and in writingAbove average skills in PowerPoint and Excel
Already interested? Apply now!What we offer – Is everything that counts being counted?  Flexible working: you decide where and when you work in consultation with your team. At home, at the office, at the client's location, or from another European country (up to 20 working days per year)Salary: in addition to your fixed salary, depending on EY's financial performance, you may be eligible for a bonus. You are also entitled to an expense allowance (depending on the position) and an internet allowance of €40 net per monthTime off: you are entitled to 29 (on senior consultant level) or 34 (on manager level) vacation days per year when full-time employed and you have the option to purchase additional days.Sabbatical: the option to take unpaid leave after consultationBirth leave: EY will pay 100% of the birth leave; in the case of additional birth leave, EY will pay 70% of the salaryPension scheme: you will start building a pension capital immediately upon joining EY. Each month, a premium is allocated to your pension account with our pension provider. You also have the option to voluntarily contribute additional funds to your pension

To learn more about working at EY, please visit the following link: What it's like to work here | EY - NetherlandsThe officeOur office in Amsterdam is located in the Zuidas, a bustling area where many businesses are situated. In our Cross Towers, Anouchka and Lucia welcome up to 1.000 people every day upon arrival. Haven't had breakfast yet? Taib will make his special smoothie for you or simply a delicious cappuccino. During the lunch break, the team of Hans and Mehdi will be ready with a fresh lunch for you. For a breathtaking view of Amsterdam, head to the 22nd floor. Collaborating takes on a new meaning with the Wavespace. This high-tech environment brings clients and colleagues together virtually from all over the world!Recruitment procedure – How can you prepare for a long life together?Our hiring process consists of several key steps. After reviewing your CV, we will schedule an introductory call to get to know each other better and address practical matters. Next, you'll have the option to have an informal coffee chat with a team member, providing an opportunity to learn more about our organization. An online assessment will be administered to evaluate relevant skills and knowledge. Subsequently, a first interview will assess team fit and personality. If successful, a second interview will involve a case study. Finally, a Partner interview will take place, where you'll have the chance to engage with our leadership. Upon successful completion of the process, we will extend a formal offer to join our team.Due to laws and regulations, and because EY (and in some cases its clients) has high demands on the reliability and integrity of its employees, every new employee will be screened. Depending on your rank the pre-employment screening could contain the following: Certificate of Conduct (in Dutch: VOG) or - if requesting a Dutch VOG is not possible - Criminal Background Check of the country you are currently living or have lived during the last five years, integrity questionnaire, verification of ID, diploma’s and/or work experience and consultation of the Dutch insolvency registry.

About the job
            
 
Introducing Toshiba Global Commerce Solutions:At Toshiba, our purpose is to create opportunities that make the retail journey you want a reality. That’s driven by our passion to give you expert guidance and the solutions you need to choose your direction, navigate obstacles, and accelerate forward to reimagine how you engage your customers in ways they’ve never seen.The ability to innovate is the key to retail success. That’s why we invest in future technologies that enable retailers to innovate faster to keep up with continuously evolving customer expectations.Bringing the retailer’s vision to life starts with creating the right strategy. We work with our clients to understand their requirements and then create a strategy that supports their business goals. We also evaluate their long-term needs and create new processes, solutions or programs truly tuned to make their business shine today and in the future.As part of Toshiba Global Commerce Solutions, you'll be an integral partner to the success of our customers. We're passionate about retail transformation and solving the problem that retailers face every day to help them create more engaging shopping experiences.Mission:Strategic partner and advisor to the customer in the field of ICT issues and solution(s) with a view to a structural relationship with Toshiba. Supports Sales in developing the ICT vision for the customer and involves colleagues in realizing and securing the Toshiba solution as a company's critical pillar for the customer's business operations. Together with colleagues, ensures a continuous optimization of the architecture and infrastructure.Workplace:Toshiba Global Commerce Solutions supports and encourages the flexibility of hybrid working.The ideal candidate will be comfortable commuting to the TGCS office location in Madrid, Spain, as well as to client sites as requested.Key Responsibilities: 1. Strategic advice to customers in the field of the ICT issue and with an automated solution (product choices) which will deliver the best result, including achieving the business objectives, as well as providing insight into the impact on the work processes. (25%)a. Understanding the business objectives, retail organization and retail processes.b. In collaboration with the customer and colleagues determine the optimal product choice(s) and logical software architecture with a view to achieving the business objective(s).c. Recording the scope of the assignment with a view to achieving the objectives and recording these in a master plan with a time schedule.d. Ask questions about the wishes of the customer to form a complete picture.e. Make efficient use of available time and resources and in consultation with other Toshiba teams.f. Determining the feasibility of the assignment within the Toshiba organization in function of time and resources.g. Support in recording the assignment in a quotation.2. Program / Project management (10%)a. Involved in the start-up of a complex and/or business critical project.b. Involved program/project management of complex and/or business critical projects.3. Transfer (10%)a. Transfer of the assignment to the PFS resources (e.g., Project manager and/or consultant).b. Follow-up and internal advice of the transferred projects/ activities with a view to alignment with the pre-determined (customer) strategy.4. Customer governance (20%)a. Organizing and conducting the strategic ICT consultation at the customer in the field of business processes, software architecture, software and infrastructure in close cooperation with Toshiba colleagues.b. Organizing and conducting an internal strategic ICT consultation.c. Securing the roadmap and continuous improvement of the customer's solutions, software architecture, software, and infrastructure in line with the Toshiba product and software developments. This in collaboration with the account manager and the product manager.5. Translating customer wishes and trends into product portfolio (10%)a. Seeing and comparing meetings with previous issues and solutions.b. Thinking along with the Product managers about the developments of the product portfolio in line with the developments at the customer.6. Link with New Business (15%)a. To make a concrete substantive contribution to the development of the New Business.b. Ensure that the PFS organization connects and is prepared in time to secure the support of the New Business.7. Performing all other activities that are determined in consultation with the manager.This is not an exhaustive list, and you may be asked to carry out other activities throughout your employment.What you will bring to the team: Previous experience working in the IT or Retail industries.Previous experience working with large retailers as a service provider, software provider or consulting company.Previous customer-facing experience in either software, hardware, or services domains.Software / Services consultancy and implementation skills.Familiar with methodologies in project implementation matters.Experience working with and installing Software/Cloud Services.Knowledge of the most common cloud public providers (Google, AWS, etc).Proficient in computer skills including MS Word, Excel, and Power Point.You are a team-player, and you adopt solution-oriented thinking.You are a go-getter, stress-resistant and flexible.Demonstrate capabilities in leadership and conduct consultant teams in Services Projects.Able to achieve organizational objectives through effective planning, punctuality, organizational, coordination, decision making, and time management skills.
Desirable: Bachelor’s degree in business administration or computer Science degrees, desired.Previous experience working with Retail POS Software.Existing relationships with decision makers in Retail segment.
Salary Information: Toshiba is the market leading provider of Retail Technology globally and provides competitive salaries and benefits package.

About the job
            
 
Senior Business Consultant - ESi –   ADP ESI is seeking to recruit a Senior Business Consultant based in EMEA to support the expansion of MNC solutions through pre-sales activities. In this pre-sales position, you'll be a trusted advisor to our clients, using your ADP service expertise and consulting skills to solve their most critical business challenges particularly related to Payroll/HR management and absence management and integration of the time solutions to the other multinational ADP offerings. In this position you will support the Multi country sales through the sales process, and support customers through the proof of concept and transition to the implementation and service teams. The successful candidate will also develop effective sales strategies with Multi country sales force, discusses time management product requirements with customers and analyze competitors' actions in the market.The candidate must have effective communication skills and be service focused, results oriented and be able to multi-task and meet deadlines. She/he will work with others in a demanding, fast-paced environment with a commitment to quality and a thorough approach to the work. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: 1. Client facing activities: · Perform Strategic selling in large MN companies environment· Increase sales performance by presenting Payroll & HR strategies and business solutions to prospects and clients· Understand client business requirements and configure the solution to demonstrate ADP's ability to solve client issues.· Understand and align customer needs with ADP MNC’s portfolio with specific but not exclusive focus on time management· Communicate with different audiences, appropriately adjust functional and technical content to meet different audience knowledge and interest, and can juggle meetings with multiple audience levels· Understand and support HR transformation discussion with prospects· Creatively and quickly respond to challenging questions with sound business acumen.· Liaise with internal partners for effective solution outcomes for the client· Utilise compelling presentation skills including the ability to take complex subjects and distil into a simplistic message to ensure that our clients/prospects understand the value and benefit of our services and multinational solutions · Support RFP response process and scripted demonstrations within domain area of expertise· Demonstrate strategic and ethical use of competitive knowledge and intelligence· Support the negotiation process on all the contractual business appendixes· Participate in marketing events 2. Operational Support: · Work with other members of the ESI Business consulting team, but also with the Business consulting teams in GES· Have the ability to work and perform under pressure in a multicultural sales environment· Have the ability to learn technology quickly through instruction and self-training· Coordinate the answers to customer requests · Prepare and delivers sales presentations· Show and demonstrate offering’s value · Participate in sales calls and meetings· Work closely with the sales team· Work closely with the Relationship Management, Implementation, Product and Client Service teams· Keep up to date with product developments· Work with the domain specialists to get information and updates on the offering· Travel to meetings with potential clients QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED: · Master or Bachelor’s degree with 2-4 years of sales or HR consulting experience with large, complex clients Preferred Expertise/Skills Preference will be given to candidates who have the following: Experience working with time management technology products and processesCollaborative, team player with strong self-starter attitudeKnowledge of Business Process Outsourcing is desired
· Communication (multi-lingual can be an advantage)· Assists in the facilitation of team and client meetings. · Delivers informative, well-organized presentations· Understands how to communicate difficult/sensitive information tactfully · Team player with good written and oral communication skills- Confident negotiator and ability to help ‘close the deal’ · Client management skills · Ability to quickly learn new procedures, skills, and techniques· Ability to work under pressure· Ability to identify and ensure the timely delivery of critical information to internal analysis teams, sponsors, customers, and other interested parties· Ability to work and communicate effectively within a global team environment· Ability to effectively prioritize work· Ability to develop and explain technical decisions· Ability to recognize and deal appropriately with sensitive and confidential information· Ability to interact effectively with technical and non-technical audiences via both verbal and written communications (e.g., technical writing, procedural development, requirements analysis)· Ability to meet inflexible deadlines· Domestic and international travel as necessary  Strong presentation skillsAbility to travel 40%-60%
ADP is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer; M/F/D/V. ADP believes that diversity leads to strength.

About the job

About the job
            
 
Realise our transformation ambitionsAre you looking for the opportunity to make a significant impact in the world of strategy and transformation? And would you like to join a team of enthusiastic colleagues to welcome you onboard?Then grab this career-building opportunity to leverage your strategy experience as the linchpin between our transformation strategy and the business. Here, you get to work at the heart of our ongoing transformation as you endeavour to bring our key strategic priorities to life in close collaboration with the business executives.“You’re close to our business and you get to work hands-on with the execution of our strategies. Your work has a real impact, and you can really leave your mark and actually see the difference you’re making,” explains Head of Technology Strategy & Execution Anders Juhl Larsen.About the jobWelcome to Strategy & ExecutionTDC NET is on a mission to connect Denmark and drive the green and digital transition through the best and fastest networks. Networks that connect us to each other and the world. Our goal is to remain the best at what we do – and in an industry where new technologies are constantly emerging, transformation is never-ending.TDC NET has 2 main business units: Technology and Delivery & Field Service, and we are on the lookout for skilled people to join Strategy and Execution in both areas of TDC NET. Technology is focused on driving key technological agendas, while D&FS represents the largest part of TDC NET with the responsibility of rolling out fiber to reach TDC NETs target of 1 m households and servicing the many customers on TDC NET’s infrastructure.The Strategy & Execution team works right at the heart of this transformation. Joining the team at our office in either Århus (Tranbjerg) or Copenhagen (Teglholmen), you will be met by tight-knit colleagues who welcome you to a project organisation that works to implement our strategy and transformation plans. The teams are responsible for driving and delivering our transformation plans in close collaboration with the Executive Management team.Work hands-on with the implementation of our strategiesAs Senior Strategy Manager, you will be hands-on in driving the transformation within TDC NET, translating the strategy into concrete actions. Your key tasks will be to break down problems into simple manageable solutions, collaborate with business line executives, as well as participate in and lead strategic projects.More specifically, you can look forward to: Collaborating with executives and colleagues across our business linesManaging projects to implement key strategic ambitions – this includes setting the project teamPreparing presentations, reporting on progress in strategic initiatives, facilitating workshops, etc.
"As a team, we’re fuelled by innovation and creativity, and we share a culture of collaboration where new ideas are discussed and valued and with a clear focus on structured problem-solving,” Anders explains.About youA strategic mind and comprehensive stakeholder management skillsYou have a well-equipped toolbox stocked with the essentials for handling strategic challenges – but the most important thing is your enthusiasm and eagerness to learn.Moreover, you can simplify complexity and translate it into easily understood solutions. Also vital are your stakeholder management skills, as you will need to get your business on board to succeed with your transformation efforts. As such, you also need to be able to navigate at all levels of an organisation from executive management to deep technical and operational experts.We also imagine that you: Bring a master’s degree in economics, finance, or business administrationHave a couple of years of experience from a similar role – experience with telco would be nice, but it is not requiredHave experience with corporate strategy projects spanning the business value chainKnow how to manage complex portfoliosAre fluent in English and Danish
"Our team is the ideal choice if you're passionate about strategic projects that bridge business issues and AI & IT solutions. We prioritize having a fun and inclusive culture that ensures you're never alone in your journey to tackle complex problem-solving; support is always at your side," says Victoria Elming, Head of Strategy and Execution, Delivery and Field Service.Ready to take the next step in your career? Contact: If you have questions about the position or want to know more about what it means to work at TDC NET, feel free to reach out to:Head of Strategy & Execution in Technology Anders Juhl Larsen at +45 21 37 77 36 orHead of Strategy & Execution in Delivery and Field Service Victoria Elming at +45 28 86 70 06Location:Teglholmsgade 1, København or Sletvej 30, AarhusProcess:We invite candidates for interviews on a continuous basis, so please apply as soon as possible and no later than December 15th, 2023.You can expect to hear from us within 3 weeks from the application date.Click in on www.tdcnet.dk to read more about TDC NET and how it is to work at us.You apply via ”Apply now” in the top left corner. Applying with your CV is sufficient.We encourage you not to include a photo in your resume or motivational letter. In TDC NET we are dedicated to fostering an inclusive culture that values diversity, and we pride ourselves on providing equal opportunities for everyone. All qualified candidates will be assessed regardless of ethnicity, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability and all the other characteristics that make us different.We are looking forward hearing from you!TDC NET - lots of benefits Engage in meaningful workThe green transition needs a strong digital infrastructure. With us you will take part in delivering the technological solutions.For all of us.We provide the working life of the futureWe set targets for a healthy and safe working environment.Our work culture is digital and flexible when compatible with tasks and colleagues.Welcome to your new hybrid workplace.Development through challenges - get lots of responsibility from day oneGet responsibility quickly and be a part of the biggest transformation in our field - ever.Be challenged.Become part of a strong networkTake part in connecting Denmark together with both new and experienced colleagues and many various professional competencies.In TDC NET we are both motivated and united by a strong network.

About the job
            
 
Managementkonsult till Uniter AB i Stockholm Vi söker civilingenjörer som vill jobba som managementkonsulter. Du ska coacha våra kundföretag att få allt som sker i företaget att börja och sluta hos kunden. Du hjälper organisationen att systematiskt och tvärfunktionellt förstå kundbehoven och strömlinjeforma processer, flöden, produkter, mjukvara och tjänster mot dessa kundbehov på det mest effektivt kända sättet.Vi jobbar med stora multinationella företag och uppdragen innebär ofta resor i världen. Även om din placering är i Stockholm där vi har vårt kontor, kommer du inte att vara där särskilt ofta eftersom dina arbetsuppgifter i huvudsak utförs hos kunderna, vilket inte sällan är på andra orter eller länder. Detta både för att besöka olika verksamhetsorter och företagens kunder. Det betyder att du helt eller åtminstone delvis kommer att spendera merparten av din tid på annan ort. Vi som jobbar på Uniter idag har 30 års erfarenhet som konsulter från svenskt näringsliv. Eftersom efterfrågan på våra tjänster ökat behöver vi din hjälp. Du kan komma direkt ifrån högskola eller universitet eller ha arbetslivserfarenhet. Vill du bli en del av ett hårt arbetande lag som vill göra något märkvärdigt av sina arbetsliv? Vill du lära dig nya produkter, tjänster och organisationer och lära känna nya kulturer och människor? Då passar du hos oss, för att få göra detta är vår belöning. Att få utmana och se människor och organisationer växa likaså. Till det kommer en bra lön. Önskad kompetensFör att ha en väl utvecklad förmåga till systematiskt tänkande vill vi att du ska vara civilingenjör. Har du utbildning i programmering kommer det väl till pass då vi utvecklar programvara i våra kunduppdrag. Du skall också vara intresserad av människor eftersom din roll är att coacha chefer och stora grupper att ändra sitt sätt att tänka och arbeta. Du ska tycka om att utmana men ha tålamod när det tar tid för organisationen att förstå. Vi jobbar i lag så du ska vara en utpräglad lagspelare. Kan du något extra språk (förutom svenska och engelska flytande som är ett krav) är det en merit.Om du tycker att detta verkar lockande vill vi gärna lära känna dig lite bättre. Anmäl ditt intresse till bjorn.sawe@uniter.se eller via LinkedIn. AnställningstypHeltid PlaceringStockholmSista ansökningsdagLöpande KontaktBjörn Säwe073-985 10 89bjorn.sawe@uniter.se

About the job
            
 
Als Business Consultant werk je samen met je collega's aan pragmatische oplossingen met een duurzaam resultaat. De projecten richten zich vooral op operatie, data & analyse en implementatie.Interessant? Lees verder!De klant realiseert concrete en duurzame oplossingen voor complexe operationele vraagstukken binnen de energie- en infrasector. Toekomstbestendig, met pragmatische realisatiekracht en sectorspecifieke kennis. Met expertise op het gebied van datamanagement, (grootschalige) implementaties en programma- en projectmanagement in operationele procesverbeteringen. En bovenal met focus op een open en constructieve samenwerking met de klant.Wat ga jij doen? Vertalen van complexe operationele uitdagingen naar pragmatische en doelgerichte aanpak;Begeleiden van organisaties in veranderingen;Meten, analyseren en verbeteren van operationele processen;Inrichten van operationele sturing en rapportages om prestatieverbeteringen te realiseren;Uitvoeren en begeleiden van projecten op het gebied van data-schoning, datamigratie en data-integratie;Meebouwen aan de verdere ontwikkeling en groei van de organisatie.
Wie ben jij? Afgeronde master;Relevante werkervaring binnen utilities of infra is een pre;Nuchter, proactief en met een can-do mentaliteit;Affiniteit met of bovenmatige interesse in processen, data en ondersteunende applicaties;Communicatief sterk en een teamspeler;Je denkt in kansen in plaats van problemen. Jij neemt het voortouw, maakt keuzes en krijgt mensen mee. Samen met anderen maak jij het verschil.
Bij de organisatie Vanaf de eerste werkdag eigen verantwoordelijkheid binnen een sector die volop in beweging is met thema’s zoals: energietransitie, energiebesparing en data en digitalisering;De ruimte om je eigen ontwikkeling vorm te geven met daarnaast meer dan voldoende interne doorgroeimogelijkheden en persoonlijke begeleiding;Een informele werkomgeving waarbij plezier maken en kwaliteit leveren voorop staat;Uitstekende arbeidsvoorwaarden met een bonusregeling, 25 vakantiedagen en een leaseauto;Een kantoor in Utrecht, waar je regelmatig samenkomt en de week gezellig afsluit.
ContactHeb je interesse in deze functie? Neem direct contact met ons op! Tel. +31 (6)15 51 57 24 en e-mail: hakima@sense-recruitment.nl

About the job
            
 
Are you the driving force behind growth and operational excellence? At Nova Reperta, we're not your average consultancy firm. We're a dynamic team of experts committed to delivering impactful guidance - combining conceptual thinking with hands-on support to our clients. Join us for a consultancy journey that's anything but ordinary and be part of a company culture that values innovation and impact.As an Management Consultant who specialises in Operational Excellence, your role involves:  Developing and implementing OpEx programs and strategies for clients to enhance performance and drive efficiency. We leverage both traditional and digital analysis methods to uncover inefficiencies and streamline operations, making meaningful impact.Building and maintain strong relationships with clients and act as a trusted advisor on all OpEx matters. This includes providing training and coaching to clients on OpEx methodologies, tools, and techniques, as well as culture development.Driving and overseeing the execution of projects, taking full ownership of workstreams including project planning, timeline management, and budgeting for client engagements.
 Perks of being a Novist: Freedom & autonomy: you’ll have the freedom to lead impactful projects and contribute to your own and NR's growth, all while showcasing your talents. Your pace isn't restricted by levels but determined by your competencies, offering you boundless opportunities to reach for the stars and fulfil your ambitions.Entrepreneurial & inclusive: An entrepreneurial and inclusive company culture applicable in client & internal context. We prioritize a profound understanding of the industry, client-centricity by creating long-term trust relationships.Growth & Trust-building: A continuous feedback culture that fosters personal growth and builds trust, encouraging you to develop yourself and others. A one-of-a-kind team of ambitious colleagues, a strong sense of camaraderie and a supportive partner/coach dedicated to assisting and pushing boundaries.Always exploring: Year-round, we spice things up with exciting events, including our epic annual ski trip to keep the good vibes flowing!
 Qualifications we value: A Bachelor’s or Master's degree in Business Administration, Operations Management, Engineering, or any related field.3-8 years of experience in operational excellence, lean management, or related field, preferably in a consulting capacity.Strong communication and interpersonal skills; you can engage with all levels of the organisation by blending IQ and EQ effortlessly.The ability to work independently and collaboratively, juggling multiple projects and priorities with ease.You speak English fluently, in addition to Dutch and/or French.Willingness to travel to client sites as required.
  Who We Are Established in 2011, Nova Reperta is a management consultancy firm with a European presence in Brussels and Amsterdam. From crafting tailored strategies to unleashing agile transformations, we we are renowned by: Partnering with a diverse range of clients, from mid-sized enterprises to industry giants;Fuelling our success with our unique blend of expertise, client-centricity, and camaraderie between our 50+ Novists;Applying our pragmatic spirit and unwavering commitment to teamwork.
When you join us, you'll not only collaborate and grow but also experience the difference that propels you to excel as a management consultant.Ready to lead, grow, and thrive? Join us at Nova Reperta – where your career takes centre stage. Apply now and embark on a consultancy adventure unlike any other.
